text.headline: Support Groups for Women
text.text: Support Groups for Women in Transition, Younger Women, Divorce, and Lesbians formed at the EWC.

text.headline: Jewish Lesbian Study Group forms
text.text: Jewish Lesbian Study Group forms and meets regularly through 1981.

text.headline: Valley Women's Voice started
text.text: Valley Women's Voice started with money from Women's Media Network; and later became an RSO group at UM.

text.headline: Support Groups for Women
text.text: Support Groups for Women Victims of Childhood Sexual Abuse, Rape Victims, Lesbian Rape Victims, Single Mothers, Lesbians, Black Women, Divorced Women, and General Support Group begin at EWC.

text.headline: First Lesbian Arts and Crafts Show
text.text: A benefit for the National Lesbbian Workforce Exchange Project at 19 Hawley St, Northampton.

text.headline: Northampton
text.text: Mary Daly speaks on Gyno-Ecology at a reception for the author at Womonfyre books.

text.headline: First Issue of Valley Womens's Voice
text.text: 8 pages

text.headline: First Wendell Country Women's Music Festival
Publication of Jan Raymond's book, The Transexual Empire
Women's Media Project expands
text.text: Women's Media Project expands to Women's Media Network, attempts to beome a resource center for women in the media in the Valley.

text.headline: New Alexandria Lesbian Library
text.text: New Alexandria Lesbian Library (founded 1974) moves Chicago to Crescent Moon Farm outside of Huntington, MA.

text.headline: Lesbian Forum formed
text.text: Lesbian Forum formed to deal with lesbian issues, has turned into discussion group.

text.headline: The Wanderground reading by Sally Gearhart
text.text: The Wanderground reading by the author Sally Gearhart and reception at Womonfyre Books.

text.headline: JEB visits Northampton
text.text: JEB visits Northampton, presents a slide show of lessbian photographs from mid-19th century to the present, reception at Womonfyre Books.

text.headline: JEB - Lesbian Images in slide show
text.text: JEB- Lesbian Images in Photography Slide Show at Unitarian Church, Northampton  (also at MHC).

text.headline: 24 hours of women's programming on WMUA
"A Poetry Reading for Lesbians"
text.text: Bet Birdfish, director of NALL, and Vemita Gray, Black Lesbian from Chicago, read their poetry at Chrysalis theatre and talk about NALL. Sponsored by Old Lady Blue Jeans

text.headline: Owners of Womonfyre Books, are threatened with vandalism and rape
text.text: Jil Krolik and Kiryo Spooner, owners of Womonfyre Books, are threatened with vandalism and rape by a group of 4 white men who invaded the bookstore.

text.headline: Valley Women's Voice moved to Northampton
text.text: 16 pages

text.headline: SCLA  discussions
text.text: SCLA met Sunday nights for discussion on different topics

text.headline: New Alexandria Lesbian Library moves to Worthington
text.text: New Alexandria Lesbian Library moves from Crescent Moon Star Farm in Huntington, MA to Worthington, MA.

Jewsih Lesbian Pesach Seder
text.text: Over 50 lesbians attend

text.headline: Performance at Polish Club
text.text: Linda Tillery and Mary Watkins perform at the Polish Club.

text.headline: New Alexandria Lesbian Library moves to Leeds. MA
text.text: Northampton-Amherst work group forms.

text.headline: Toni Cade Bambara speaks at Smith College
text.text: Toni Cade Bambara speaks at Smith College, reading from her short story collection, Gorilla My Love, sponsored by Afro-American Studies at Smith, Black Studies at Amherst College, and Womonfyre Books.

text.headline: Women coming out as lesbians support group
text.text: EWC

text.headline: La Mix formed
text.text: La Mix formed, prior to this they had worked together without a name At Rahars for six weeks. La Mix started having women's dances at Hangar One.

text.text: HCWC

text.text: First meeting of GALA (Gay and Lesbian Activists), potluck with 15 people.

text.text: Dance at Davic, music by Faye. sponsored by SCLA, Women in Struggle, and Northampton Committee on El Salvador.

Third incest Survivors Therapy Group, for lesbians only
Smith administration tried to close Hover House
text.text: Smith administration tried to close Hover House but were not allowed by the Trustees because they didn't give the current residents warning that they would close the house.

text.headline: The Common Womon Club buildings on Masonic Street are sold
Valley Women's Martial Arts moves from Masonic St. to Center St.
Womonfyre Books moves from Masonitc St. to Center St.
"A Woman's Workshop: For Jewish Lesbians and Thier Friends" draws over 100 lesbians, SC.
4th Wendell Country Women's Music Festival.
text.text: 400-500 women attend

text.headline: Open house for lesbian community at New Alexandria Lesbian Library

text.text: at HC sponsored by NALL, a benefit to make NALL wheelchair accessible.

text.headline: "Old Lady Blue Jeans"
text.text: a reading by Elana Dykewomon for Lesbians and girl children only at SC

text.headline: "Anti Racism CR"
text.text: For GALA members at SC

text.headline: North Valley Typesetting and Graphics
text.text: Four women buy production equipment from New Roots to form a designer and artist cooperative; they were unsuccessful as such and became the business collective, North Valley Typesetting and Graphics in Greenfield

text.headline: Hampshire Women's center and Lesbian Alliance Progressive Film Series
Valley Women's Martial Arts gets Dojo in Thornes
Lesbian Incest Survivors Therapy Group forms
Lesbian Rape alert meeting
text.text: Lesbian Rape alert meeting in Northampton, Thornes Mkt. after 2 lesbians are raped in Northampton and another woman in 7 weeks. About 200 women attended

text.headline: Debbie Fier's first album, "In Your Hands" is released.
Anti-KKK march
text.text: sponsored by GALA

text.text: celebrating her new album, sponsored by Variations at Hotel Northampton
